author: neels
msg: Cosmetic. Untangle get_dir_status() from explicit file- and unversioned
targets. Probably this mess is a legacy of adm_access batons, now it can be
much easier on the eye.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/status.c
(one_child_status, get_child_status):
New functions, taking over two of three tasks previously mangled into
get_dir_status().
(get_dir_status):
Only efficiently retrieve all children's information and pass on to
one_child_status().  Remove parameter SELECTED and all SELECTED != NULL
scopes. get_child_status() is now responsible for those.  Rename vars.
(svn_wc__internal_walk_status):
Call get_dir_status() only on actual versioned dirs. Throw all others at
get_child_status().  Iron out code around ERR and INFO.  Rename vars.
(make_dir_baton, handle_statii, close_directory):
Remove SELECTED from get_dir_status() calls, all previously passed NULL.
